titleStmt.title: The abridgment of Eusebius Pamphilius's ecclesiastical history in two parts ... whereunto is added a catalogue of the synods and councels which were after the days of the apostles : together with a hint of what was decreed in the same / by William Caton.
Ecclesiastical history. English
titleStmt.author: Eusebius, of Caesarea, Bishop of Caesarea, ca. 260-ca. 340.

titleStmt.title: The abridgment of Eusebius Pamphilius's ecclesiastical history in two parts ... whereunto is added a catalogue of the synods and councels which were after the days of the apostles : together with a hint of what was decreed in the same / by William Caton.
Ecclesiastical history. English
titleStmt.author: Eusebius, of Caesarea, Bishop of Caesarea, ca. 260-ca. 340.
Caton, William, 1636-1665.

editionStmt.edition: The second ed. with larg editions by another hand.

notesStmt.note: "Part I. A compendious commemoration of the remarkablest chronologies which are contained in that famous history. Part II. A summary or brief hint of the twelve persecutions sustained by the antient Christians with a compendious paraphrase upon the same."
"Some passages out of a letter of a person of quality : giving a true relation in general concerning the heavenly lives of the primitive Christians"--p. 209-130 [i.e. 230]
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
